channel.title: Culture - Digg
channel.description: Culture on Digg: the best articles, videos, tweets, and original content that the web is talking about right now

item.title: The Narrator Of 'Too Hot To Handle' Knows This Is A Ridiculous Show
item.description: The cheeky charm of Netflix's reality dating show "Too Hot to Handle" all comes from narrator Desiree Burch, who is never onscreen but cracks jokes like she's binge-watching alongside viewers at home.
item.kicker: MEET YOUR TOUR GUIDE THROUGH HELL

item.title: It's No Coincidence That Various TV News Shows Sound The Same — They All Have Identical Scripts
item.description: This mashup of local TV news networks gets a bit robotic when you hear over 30 news anchors say the same thing. As they themselves will admit, "this is extremely dangerous to our democracy."

item.title: An Alternative History Of Post-WWII Hollywood Is Explored In Trailer Of Ryan Murphy's New Show 'Hollywood'
item.description: Murphy's vision of post-war Hollywood is one where people of color managed to break into Hollywood's studio system. "Hollywood" will be available for streaming on Netflix on May 1.

item.title: Here's What Hogwarts Fashion Would Look Like In Every Era From The 1920s To 2020s
item.description: We petition this to be the official costumes of the Harry Potter movies.
item.kicker: HARRY POTTER AND THE DASHING HALLOWS

item.title: Meet The Upscalers
item.description: Stuck indoors? Try restoring an old TV show or movie.

item.title: Three Nights With 311 During The Onset Of The Coronavirus
item.description: For 311's 30th anniversary, the band took over the Park MGM in Las Vegas, playing 102 songs over three nights with no repeats. Our writer went to the desert on the eve of a pandemic to meet the superfans of America's most positive band — and figure out why he stopped loving them.

item.title: The Complicated Truths Of Dr. Dre's 'The Chronic'
item.description: No rap album has quite the mythology attached to it — as a game changer, a king maker, a genre expander. But legends aren't exactly fact.

item.title: We Are Living In A Failed State
item.description: The coronavirus didn't break America. It revealed what was already broken.

item.title: The Coronavirus Revealed America's Failures
item.description: The coronavirus didn't break America. It revealed what was already broken.

item.title: It's Actually A Great Time To Try To Sell A TV Show
item.description: How Hollywood is adapting to the pandemic.
item.kicker: TIME TO OPEN UP THE DRAFT FOLDER

item.title: The Quiet Revolution Of Animal Crossing
item.description: In the midst of a pandemic, it's delightful to imagine doing whatever you like without worrying about making a living.

item.title: Music Teacher Creates A Soothing Song About COVID-19 That Is Not Blood-Curdling At All
item.description: During times of stress and hardship, we really need songs like this to help us manage our emotions.
item.kicker: LOWER YOUR VOLUME FOR THIS ONE

item.title: What Would Have Happened To Wilson After 'Cast Away'?
item.description: An oceanographer, a marine biologist, a ship captain and the former CEO of FedEx weigh in.

item.title: 'Too Hot To Handle' Is Netflix's Most Disconcerting Reality TV Show Yet
item.description: Ten contestants are invited to an island, prohibited from having sex, and encouraged to become "authentically connected." This is not "Love Is Blind." It is something much, much worse.
item.kicker: BAD FOR THEM, GOOD FOR US

item.title: We're All Living In 'The Lighthouse'
item.description: Signs that life in isolation is like Robert Eggers's 2019 horror movie "The Lighthouse," now streaming on Amazon Prime.
item.kicker: THEY GAVE US ALL THE CLUES

item.title: Guy Notices A Fun Coincidence With The Super Mario Bros. Flagpole Fanfare Music And The Power-Up Sound Effect
item.description: Did Nintendo composer Koji Kondo hide an Easter egg inside Super Mario Bros.?

item.title: 'Teenage Dirtbag' 2.0
item.description: Wheatus' anthem of teenage alienation has grown into an enduring cult classic. So why has the band spent the past year re-creating it note-for-note?

item.title: The Unbelievable Way Tom Cruise's HALO Jump Was Filmed For 'Mission Impossible: Fallout'
item.description: This fascinating side-by-side clip shows that the real stunt hero of the scene wasn't Cruise, but rather the camera man who jumped off the plane backwards and filmed Cruise with a camera on his head the whole way down.

item.title: The Writer Of 'Demolition Man' On The Predictive Power Of His 1993 Movie
item.description: In this interview with "Demolition Man" writer Daniel Waters, he discusses the accidental coronavirus-era prescience of his 1993 action comedy starring Sylvester Stallone, Sandra Bullock and Wesley Snipes, from no-contact high fives to seashells.

item.title: The 'Tiger King' Informant Was My Coworker At PetCo
item.description: I worked at PetCo for a whole year when I was 17 and one day my shift fatefully overlapped with James Garretson. Yes, he let me pet a lion. Yes, I was stoned the whole time.
item.kicker: KEEP YOUR ENEMIES CLOSE, CO-WORKERS CLOSER

item.title: How Morley Became The Cigarette Brand Of Choice For Hollywood
item.description: If you pay close attention to TV and movies, you'll begin to recognize a recurring cigarette brand.

item.title: This Recreation Of 'The Office' In 'Animal Crossing' Is An Absolute Masterpiece
item.description: This the only remake of "The Office" we accept.
item.kicker: LET THIS BE A WHOLE SERIES

item.title: The Guys On A Mission To Fact-Check The Size Of Every Porn Star's Penis
item.description: Are the huge penises in porn really that big? On Reddit's Measured Pornstars, dick detectives try to calculate the true penis size of male porn stars.

item.title: Hollywood Is All But Writing Off 2020. What Does That Mean For The Future Of Movies?
item.description: The studio executives and talent agents responsible for keeping the business part of showbiz beating ever forward against the tide have referred to the worldwide pandemic as "nuclear winter." "Doomsday," even.

item.title: Watch This Quarantined Family Recreate Journey's 'Separate Ways (Worlds Apart)' Music Video Scene-For-Scene
item.description: Steven Heller recruited his family to do a shot-for-shot remake of Journey's classic 1980s music video. The side-by-side comparison shows their impressive dedication to detail.

item.title: Here's The First Clip From 'Stardust,' The David Bowie Biopic Starring Johnny Flynn And Marc Maron
item.description: A theatrical date hasn't been announced, but keep an eye out for a release this year.

item.title: Who's Actually Horny On Main When Everyone's Horny On Main?
item.description: As media, brands, influencers, and all your friends pivot to horny™, some are raising the bar to horny levels beyond belief.

item.title: The Way This Indie Filmmaker Uses Motion Tracking To Transform A Tiny Green Screen Set Into A Massive Digital World Is Mind-Blowing
item.description: When you don't have the money to build lavish sets, that's when creativity comes in.

item.title: 'Cats' Is Even More Bonkers When You Watch It With The Audio Description Track On Blu-Ray
item.description: Whoever had to do this job, explaining what was happening on screen visually for the "Cats" movie, we salute you and we hope you're okay.

item.title: Why Americans Are Too Angry To Fix The American Dream
item.description: We cannot survive as a nation where ZIP code is destiny.

item.title: BBC Weatherman Closes Off His Forecast With Unexpected Drum Cover Of BBC's Outro Music
item.description: It's cloudy with 100% chance of a drum solo in the afternoon.

item.title: Tax Incentives And The Human Imagination
item.description: It would be interesting to look at locations of the American popular imagination, as seen in movies and TV, mapped against regional tax breaks for the film industry.

item.title: How Does One Actually Go About Becoming a LEGO Master?
item.description: "LEGO Masters" finalists Boone and Mark explain how they built their legacies.

item.title: Twenty Years Later, 'American Psycho' Has Only Grown More Timely
item.description: Patrick Bateman's search for identity in Mary Harron's 2000 film is a story that's inched closer and closer to our modern existence.

item.title: 'Who Wants To Be A Millionaire' Wants To Be A Megahit Again
item.description: ABC has rolled out a celebrity edition of what was once the most popular program on television, this time helmed by Jimmy Kimmel. Can the game show become a hit again?

item.title: Hollywood Casts A Very Flattering Light On Right-Wing White Women
item.description: In reimagining the conservative activist Phyllis Schlafly as a prestige-TV antihero, the new FX series "Mrs. America" overlooks some uncomfortable realities.

item.title: Here's A Genius Rendition Of 'Mr. Brightside' Sung In The Style Of The B-52s
item.description: Forget about "Love Shack." "Mr. Brightside" is actually the B-52s' best song ever.

item.title: The Medical Advisors For The Movie 'Contagion' Saw A Pandemic Coming, But Got One Big Thing Wrong
item.description: CNBC tracked down some of the film's scientific advisors to ask about its scientific rigor and how they're thinking about it today.

item.title: How To Play The Music From The Coffin Dance Meme On The Keyboard
item.description: Vinheteiro provides some service journalism with a demonstration of how to play Vicetone & Tony Igy's EDM tune "Astronomia", which was famously mashed up with footage of Ghanian pallbearers.

item.title: Watch Old Hollywood Stars Swear — A Lot — In Hilarious Bloopers From Classic Films
item.description: We tend to think of old Hollywood stars as elegant and glamorized and refined — but turns out many had quite a potty mouth.

item.title: Watch Old Hollywood Stars Swear — A Lot — In Hilarious Bloopers From Classic Films
item.description: We tend to think of old Hollywood stars as elegant and glamorized and refined — but turns out many had quite a potty mouth.

item.title: The 'Office' Cast Members Who Had The Most Screen Time In Each Season, Charted
item.description: Here are the actors who had the most screen time in sitcom, ranked.

item.title: Here's Why Almost No Sitcoms Use Laugh Tracks Anymore
item.description: The laugh track was once ubiquitous in sitcoms — why is that no longer the case?

item.title: A Very Close Look Inside The Mandalorian's Ship
item.description: Know what I love? Cross-sections, aka cut-aways. Know what else I love (though that love has been worn to a paper-thin nub in recent years)? Star Wars. Let's combine 'em.

item.title: This Absolutely Unhinged 'Gossip Girl' Meme Is Perfect For These Unhinged Times
item.description: Who started doing this? What is broken inside of them? We will never know and we do not care. Let's just chase the joy this meme brings.

item.title: The Honest Trailer For 'Cats' Reminds Us How Truly Deranged The Movie Was
item.description: Once upon a time in 2019, there was this really batsh*t crazy movie called "Cats" — remember that?

item.title: Man Plays The Weeknd's 'Blinding Lights' From Scratch By Manually Entering In Instrumental Loops On GarageBand
item.description: A very patient YouTuber plays The Weeknd's "Blinding Lights" by entering in a series of commands via the digital audio workstation on their iPhone X.

item.title: How 'Better Call Saul' Managed To Do The Impossible And Be A Sequel As Good As The Original
item.description: The key to the show's good writing is that it doesn't have to follow the rules of most prestige TV shows.

item.title: An Examination Of Christian Bale's 12 Best Roles
item.description: Looking at the actor's most important performances, 20 years on from his breakout in "American Psycho."

item.title: Buddhist Monk Performs A Very Enlightened Cover Of The Beatles' 'Yellow Submarine'
item.description: Buddhist monk Kossan1108 uses just a drum, a standing bell, a wooden fish, a gong and a bell to play a classic Beatles song.
